section.name: Stress
section.description: Tests designed to stress the app

custom.preconds: Logged into app as a teacher with a class containing several students
custom.steps: 1. Take device offline 2. Launch app 3. Take at least 10 distinct photos and/or videos 4. Queue each photo to upload associated with specific student or students - keeping track of which photo goes with which student(s) 5. Put device online 6. Go back into the app
custom.expected: * When the app is resumed, all the photos should upload * Each photo is associated with the correct student(s) (can be verified on the website, in View Documentation) * No photo is duplicated

case.title: Preview Mighty Minutes Sample Packs before Sign In
Preview Mighty Minutes Sample Packs in Spanish before Sign In

custom.notes: Sign in to unlock the complete set of Mighty Minutes® Cards - Username is case insensitive - Password is case sensitive
custom.steps: 1. Start Mighty Minutes® app 2. Select Sign in from the bottom of the screen 3. Enter valid username 4. Enter corresponding password 5. Click Submit button - see Login Success popup message "Congratulations, you have unlocked the complete collection of Mighty Minutes®! 6. Click Ok on Login Success popup message - You will be logged in into the app - You will land on Home screen

custom.notes: Sign in to unlock the complete set of Mighty Minutes® Cards
custom.steps: 1. Start Mighty Minutes® app 2. Select Sign in from the bottom of the screen 3. Enter Invalid Username or Password 4. Click Submit button - "Invalid credentials" - Not logged in 5. Enter email associated with the account and the correct password - "Invalid credentials" - Not logged in

custom.notes: Sign in to unlock the complete set of Mighty Minutes® Cards - Username is case insensitive - Password is case sensitive
custom.preconds: New User Sign in for the 1st time
custom.steps: 1. Start Mighty Minutes® app 2. Select Sign in from the bottom of the screen 3. Enter valid username 4. Enter corresponding password 5. Click Submit button - see Login Success popup message "Congratulations, you have unlocked the complete collection of Mighty Minutes®! 6. Click Ok on Login Success popup message - You will be logged in into the app - You will receive a welcome email at the email address associated with your MyTeachingStrategies® account

case.title: Account locked by Repeatedly Entering Incorrect Password

custom.notes: Sign in to unlock the complete set of Mighty Minutes® Cards
custom.steps: 1. Start Mighty Minutes® app 2. Select Sign in from the bottom of the screen 3. Enter valid username with incorrect password 4. Click Submit - see red message " Invalid credentials" 5. Repeat Step previous 2 steps 3 times - each time see red message "Invalid credentials" 6. Repeat steps 5th time - see red message "Account locked" 7. Restart app 8. Enter same username and the correct password - see red message "account locked", not able to login

case.title: Non DCR Access - End of the Access Warning

custom.steps: 1. Sign in to Mighty Minutes® as non DCR subscriber - see a modal notifying of the imminent end of the beta period (and therefore the end of access). Messaging to come from marketing.

1. Sign in to Mighty Minutes® app - home screen opens 2. View screen - see 4 card categories: Family Childcare; Infants, Toddlers & Twos; Preschool, Kindergarden - see 'About' at the bottom - see 'Spanish' switch at the bottom - see "Sign Out'
1. From Home page select 'About' option - verify Mighty Minutes text fits on the screen 2. Select 'x' in the left top corner - 'About' screen closes - rerun to Home page
1. From Home Page, turn on Spanish switch - Spanish switch turns green - verify all text, tabs, titles translated to Spanish 2. Turn Spanish switch off - green switch icon changes back to clear

1. From Home Page select 'Sign Out' - message appear: 'Sign Out of Mighty Minutes® 'Are you sure you want to sign out?' with No/ Yes options 2. Select 'Yes' - signed out - see Mighty Minutes Sign In page
1. From Home Page select 'Sign Out' - message appear: 'Sign Out of Mighty Minutes® 'Are you sure you want to sign out?' with No/ Yes options 2. Select 'No' - user returns to Home Page

custom.notes: Sign in to unlock the complete set of Mighty Minutes® Cards
custom.steps: 1. Sign in to Mighty Minutes® app - home screen opens 2. See 4 Card Packs with different color squares on the right side next to each pack: - Family Child Care ( blue square) - Infants, Toddlers & Twos (light blue square) - Preschool (turquoise square) - Kindergarden (purple square) 3. Selecting each of Card Packs will redirect to full list of Cards
1. Sign in to Mighty Minutes® app - home screen opens 2. Navigate to any of Card Packs - full list of cards opens 3. Select any card - card opens - the full card is visible (scroll to the bottom)

1. Select objective sort, verify that the list is sorted by objective 2. In objective sort open an area verify that the area top color has merged with the title area 3. In objective sort open an area verify that the arrow animates to the down position, press it again verify that it animates back 4. In objective sort open an area verify that the area animates to the top of the screen, press it again verify that it animates back 5. In objective sort open a card, verify that the entire card contents can be viewed in the scrollable area
1. Sign in to Mighty Minutes® app - home screen opens 2. Navigate to any of Card Packs - full list of cards opens 3. Tap on 'Card Number' on top of the screen - cards are sorted by Card Number
1. Sign in to Mighty Minutes® app - home screen opens 2. Navigate to any of Card Packs - full list of cards opens 3. Tap on 'Objective' on top of the screen - cards are sorted by Objective

1. Sign in to Mighty Minutes® app - home screen opens 2. Navigate to any of Card Packs - full list of cards opens 3. Tap on 'Objective' on top of the screen 4. See 8 available Objectives: - Social- Emotional - Physical - Language - Cognitive - Literacy - Mathematics - Science and Technology - The Arts 5. Select any of the Objectives - selected Objective opens displaying cards related to this Objective
1. Verify that back option works as expected on all screens 2. If a card is open, back closes the card.

custom.notes: Keep track of your most used Mighty Minutes® by saving them as favorites. Each pack has its own set of favorites.
custom.steps: 1. Sign in to Mighty Minutes® app - home screen opens 2. Add multiple Cards to Favorites 3. Navigate to Favorites 4. View My Favorites screen - All added Cards appear in Favorites and sorted by card #

case.title: Clear My Favorites - Select No option

custom.preconds: Add a few Cards to Favorites
custom.steps: 1. Navigate to any of Card Packs - full list of cards opens 3. Navigate to 'Favorites' tab at the bottom of the screen - My Favorites list opens 6. Press 'Clear My Favorites' - popup message 'Are you sure? This action removes all cards from your favorites and cannot be undone. Continue? appear with No/ Yes options 7. Select 'No' option - Popup message disappear - Cards are not removed from My Favorites

case.title: Clear My Favorites - Select Yes option

custom.preconds: Add a few Cards to Favorites
custom.steps: 1. Navigate to any of Card Packs - full list of cards opens 3. Navigate to 'Favorites' tab at the bottom of the screen - My Favorites list opens 6. Press 'Clear My Favorites' - popup message 'Are you sure? This action removes all cards from your favorites and cannot be undone. Continue? appear with No/ Yes options 7. Select 'Yes' option - Popup message disappear - All Cards are removed from My Favorites

custom.notes: Keep track of your most used Mighty Minutes® by saving them as favorites. Each pack has its own set of favorites.
custom.steps: 1. Sign in to Mighty Minutes® app - home screen opens 2. Navigate to any of Card Packs - full list of cards opens 3. Select any card - card opens 4. Tag card as Favorites by tapping on clear 'heart' icon in the top right corner of the card below card title and number - clear 'heart' icon changes to blue 'heart' icon, indicating card was added to Favorites 5. Navigate to 'Favorites' tab at the bottom of the screen to verify Card was added to 'Favorites' - Card was added to 'Favorites'

Select card in Favorites - card opens 4. Tap on blue 'heart' icon in the top right corner - blue 'heart' icon changes to clear 'heart' icon indicating Card was removed from Favorites 6. Tap '<' icon in the top left corner to navigate back to Favorites - Card is removed from Favorites

custom.preconds: Add a few Cards to Favorites

custom.notes: Add individual Mighty Minutes® cards to a keyring. Each pack has its own keyring which stores the activities you want to use throughout a particular day or week.
custom.steps: 1. Sign in to Mighty Minutes® app - home screen opens 2. Navigate to any of Card Packs - full list of cards opens 3. Select any card - card opens 4. Add card to 'Keyring' by tapping on clear 'lollypop' icon in the top right corner of the card below card title and number, next to 'heart' icon - clear 'lollypop' icon changes to blue 'lollypop' icon, indicating card was added to Keyring 5. Navigate to 'Keyring' tab at the bottom of the screen to verify Card was added to 'Keyring' - Card was added to 'Keyring'

case.title: Search for Keywords & Phrases found within the Card Title and "what you do" section of the card

custom.notes: As a teacher using Mighty Minutes, I would like to be able to search for keywords & phrases found within the card title and "what you do" sections of the card.
custom.steps: 1. Sign in to Mighty Minutes® 2. Select any card pack 3. Select 'Search' icon in the top right corner 4. Type in keyword or phrases found within the card title or "what you do' section of the card - verify sorted cards contain typed keyword or phrases within the card title or "what you do" section of the card
1. Sign in to Mighty Minutes® 2. Select any card pack 3. Select 'Search' icon in the top right corner 4. Type in numbers or special characters - 'No Matching Results' message will display
1. Sign in to Mighty Minutes® app 2. Select any card pack 3. Select 'Search' icon in the top right corner - search field opens 4. Select 'x' - search field closes

1. Sign in to Mighty Minutes® app - home screen opens 2. Navigate to 'Settings' menu in the top right corner 3. Switch to Spanish language - verify all text on the page changed to Spanish - verify all text on the home screen is Spanish - verify all text on the card screen is Spanish - verify All, Favorites, Keyring tabs are in Spanish - verify Objective and Card Number areas are in Spanish - verify that all text on the card content is Spanish
1. Sign in to Mighty Minutes® app - home screen opens 2. From home screen in portrait and landscape open a card and change the orientation 3. Check that the card fills the view
On iPhone, orientation is not available

1. Sign in to Mighty Minutes® app - home screen opens 2. Navigate to 'Settings' menu in the top right corner 3. Select Sign Out - Sign Out of Mighty Minutes® message appear 'Are you sure you want to sign out?' - see No/ Yes options 4. Select No option - Sign Out message disappear - Settings screen remains open

1. Sign in to Mighty Minutes® app - home screen opens 2. Navigate to 'Settings' menu in the top right corner 3. Select Sign Out - Sign Out of Mighty Minutes® message appear 'Are you sure you want to sign out?' - see No/ Yes options 4. Select Yes option - Sign Out message disappear - Settings screen remains open - Sign Out option is not visible on the Settings screen - sample decks are available - sign in message is visible on the home screen

case.title: Administrator Log In with tadpoles® email and password

custom.steps: 1. Navigate to www.tadpoles.com 2. Select 'log in' 3. Select 'educators click here' 4. Select 'tadpoles' button to login with tadpoles email and password 5. Select 'Submit' - successfully logged in to tadpoles web application - land on tadpoles® administrator dashboard

case.title: Administrator Log In with MyTeachingStrategies® credentials

custom.steps: 1. Navigate to www.tadpoles.com 2. Select 'log in' 3. Select 'educators click here' 4. Select 'MyTeachingStrategies®' button to login with MyTeachingStrategies® credentials 5. Select 'Submit' - successfully logged in to tadpoles web application - land on tadpoles® administrator dashboard - if you have been assigned a classroom, you will only see that classroom - if you have been assigned “all,” you will be able to select any classroom to view, add, or edit lesson plan information

case.title: Administrator Sign In with Google credentials

custom.steps: 1. Navigate to www.tadpoles.com 2. Select 'log in' 3. Select 'educators click here' 4. Select 'Google Sign in' button to login with Google credentials - Sign in with Google page opens 5. Enter your Gmail address 6. Select 'Next' - you will log in through Google's authentication process - no additional or unique password is required to access your tadpoles® account - land on tadpoles® administrator dashboard

custom.preconds: If you’re already logged in, select 'logout'
custom.steps: 1. Go to www.tadpoles.com and click “log in 2. Select 'educators click here' 3. Select 'tadpoles' button 4. Click the 'Forgot your password? button on the right side of the screen - Request a password reset page opens 5. Enter the email address that you use to sign into tadpoles® 6. Select 'Submit' - You will receive an email at the address you entered with a link to reset your password 7. Select 'continue' and enter your new password - password needs to be longer than 10 characters

case.title: Forgot Password for Sign In with Google credentials

custom.steps: 1. If you're using a Google email address as your login credentials, you'll need to reset the password to your Google account through Google

case.title: Family Members Sign Up without Gmail account

custom.preconds: Before a family member can set up an account in tadpoles®, an administrator must first add the family member as a contact to a child's record
custom.steps: 1. Navigate to www.tadpoles.com 2. Select 'log in' 3. Select 'families click here' 4. Select 'tadpoles' 5. Select Sign Up - Step 1. Create a user page appear 6. Enter your email address 7. Select 'Submit' - 'Check your email!' message appear - you will receive an email with additional login information 8. Open email - see 'Complete your Tadpoles registration email

case.title: Family Members Sign In with Gmail Account

custom.steps: 1. Navigate to www.tadpoles.com 2. Select 'log in' 3. Select 'families click here' 4. Select 'Google Sign in' - you will be logged into tadpoles®

1. Log in to www.tadpoles.com - land on home attendance page 2. Select 'All' or any one Class from 'choose a classroom' dashboard 3. Select 'Students' from attendance dashboard - students only will display 4. Select 'Suff' from attendance dashboard - stuff only will display 5. Select 'Combined' from attendance dashboard - all children and staff will display 6. Select 'Filter by name' option from attendance dashboard - able to filter by name

1. Log in to www.tadpoles.com - land on home attendance page 2. View 'attendance' column list: - show stuff and children names - show stuff and children checked in/out/total hours - show stuff and children highlighted in blue & pink colors: - hover over the name to see the reason - blue color - absent sick - pink color - absent on vacation 3. Hover over the stuff or child name who are checked in to see quick overview with his or her transitions or movements around the school building for the current day

custom.notes: Allows to view the attendance list for current and previous date.
custom.steps: 1. Log in to www.tadpoles.com - land on home attendance page 2. From the attendance page click on calendar 3. Select a few previous days - verify updated attendance list per selected days
1. Log in to www.tadpoles.com - land on home attendance page 2. From the attendance page click on 'search bar' 3. Type in child's/ teacher's name - searched child's/ teacher's name appear

custom.notes: Center stats are reflective of the current classroom box that you have selected
custom.steps: 1. Log in to www.tadpoles.com - land on home attendance page 2. Select classroom from choose a classroom - center stats adjusts to reflect selected classroom 3. Select All from choose a classroom - center stats adjusts to reflect entire school 4. Hover over enrollment box - show actual number of children enrolled - show daily enrollment graph - hover over one of the bars on the graph it will break down the enrollment for that morning, afternoon and all day 5. Hover over reminders box - notifies of any approaching birthdays - reminds of any due days for the child, like next medical due day - reminds staff next physical due day 6. Hover over out today - see students out today - see children names - see reason of absence - see origin, meaning who entered the absence (administrator, teacher, child's family)

1. Log in to www.tadpoles.com - land on home attendance page 2. Select Class from 'choose a classroom' dashboard - classroom name lists at the top of the page - attendance page will adjust to reflect current class selection

1. Log in to www.tadpoles.com - land on home attendance page 2. Select 'All' Class from 'choose a classroom' dashboard - school name lists at the top of the page - see attendance information for the entire school - attendance page will adjust to reflect current school selection

1. Navigate to www.tadpoles.com 2. Select 'educators click here' - land on home attendance page 2. From the attendance page of dashboard, select 'Add Class' - small add class screen opens 3. Type in class name and select child type 4. Select 'Create' - classroom added to your account - classroom appeared in the 'choose a classroom' dashboard

1. Navigate to www.tadpoles.com 2. Select 'educators click here' - land on home attendance page 3. From the attendance dashboard, select a classroom box 4. Select 'edit' - edit screen opens - edit some fields 5. Select 'Done' - verify changes are saved

1. Navigate to www.tadpoles.com 2. Select 'educators click here' - land on home attendance page 3. Select class from 'choose a classroom' 4. Select red 'delete' option - 'Confirm. Are you sure you want to delete [class name]?' message appear 5. Select 'Yes' - class deleted and disappears from 'choose a classroom' dashboard

Are you sure you want to revive [class name]?' message appear 6. Select 'Yes' - class is indeleted - undeleted class tile becomes regular color

custom.preconds: Delete one or two classes

custom.preconds: Delete one or two classes

custom.preconds: Have some children and staff in

1. Log in to www.tadpoles.com - land on home attendance page 2. Select any classroom tile 3. Click yellow 'edit' button - edit [classroom] screen opens 4. Change class name 5. Select 'Done' - class name updates at the bottom of the tile

1. Log in to www.tadpoles.com - land on home attendance page 2. Select 'All' Class from 'choose a classroom' dashboard 3. Select 'Edit Closures' - edit closures calendar opens 4. Select date to add closure - add closure screen opens 5. Type in reason for closure - by default, closure start and end date will match selected date - closure applies to location selected by default 6. Select 'Save' - closure appears on calendar 7. Select 'Done' 8. Select 'Edit Closures' - see created closure on the calendar

custom.preconds: Create Closures

Select any Closure - adit closure screen opens 5. Edit reason to closure 6. Edit closure start and end dates 7. Select 'Save' - verify closure has been updated

custom.preconds: Add closures
custom.steps: 1. Log in to www.tadpoles.com - land on home attendance page 2. Select 'All' Class from 'choose a classroom' dashboard 3. Select 'Edit Closures' - edit closures calendar opens 4. Select any Closure - adit closure screen opens 5. Select 'Delete' - 'Confirm. This action can not be undone, are you sure you want to delete {closure name]?' 6. Select 'Yes' - return to edit closure calendar screen - closure deleted

Under 'profile' column see fields: - first name - last name - birthday - next medical - note - private note - quick lists - new quick list, with 'add' button 5. Under' enrollment' column see: - location - homeroom - curriculum - status - schedule, able to select days - enrollent - enrollment date - graduation day 6. Under 'contacts' see: - contacts square icons, with name on top and phone # at the bottom of the icon - 'add +' option

custom.notes: Check in allows to check in a child to tadpoles from administrator dashboard
custom.steps: 1. Log in to www.tadpoles.com 2. From the attendance page of dashboard, select a child 3. Select blue 'check in' option - child profile appears in the "in' column on the right of the attendance dashboard - child's name and time in appear in 'attendance' column on the left of the attendance dashboard

custom.preconds: Child is checked in

Select 'sick' reason - see 'out a day' title on top of the popup screen - child's name below title - reason: sick, vacation, other - 'excused, unexcused' (can be designated for each type of absence) - 'first day out' field - 'returning on' field - 'sickness' optional field (will populate on a weekly sickness report) - future option the left (used for scheduled absence) - white 'Cancel' and blue 'Save and Close' buttons 5. Select 'vacation' reason - see - 'first day out' field - 'returning on' field - future option the left (used for scheduled absence) - white 'Cancel' and blue 'Save and Close' buttons 6. Select 'other' reason - see - 'first day out' field - 'returning on' field 'note' optional field - future option the left (used for scheduled absence) - white 'Cancel' and blue 'Save and Close' buttons

custom.preconds: 1. Log in to www.tadpoles.com 2. From the attendance page of dashboard, select a child 3. Select black 'move' button
custom.steps: 1. Allows you as an administrator to mark any transition for a child directly from dashboard - see 'move' title on top of the popup screen - child's name below title - homeroom option with dropdown class selection - 'Note: The homeroom is the room where the child starts his or her day' on the left - blue 'Done' button

custom.notes: Email will be sent to any primary contact listed on child's profile
custom.steps: 1. Log in to www.tadpoles.com 2. From the attendance page of dashboard, select a child 3. Select yellow 'send note' button - send a note popup screen opens - see 'send a note' title on top - see child's name below title - see 'send me a copy' checkbox - see turquoise 'email' option selected by default - see 'to [child's name] contacts with primary and guardian status 'your message subject' - see 'your message to parents' field - see 'add PDF' - allows to attach PDF files from the computer - see 'view past notes' from 'your message to parents' field - see blue 'send email' button 4. Select 'view past notes' from 'your message to parents' field - past notes appear - see 'filter by message' option on top of all past notes list - see 'show full message contents' checkbox - 'load more' option on the right below all past notes - pressing 'X' in the top right corner of all past notes, will close all past notes and return to 'your message to parent' field 5. Press 'X' in the top right corner pd 'send a note' popup screen - 'send a note' screen closed - return to attendance dashboard page

custom.notes: 1. Text will be sent to any primary contact listed on a child's profile 2. It's a simple way to send a note or a reminder as a text message can't be replied to
custom.steps: 1. Log in to www.tadpoles.com 2. From the attendance page of dashboard, select a child 3. Select yellow 'send note' button - send a note popup screen opens with 'email' option selected by default 4. Select 'text' option - 'text' option turns green once selected - see 'send a note' title on top of the popup screen - see child's name below title - see 'text' option in green - see 'to [child's name] contacts with primary status/ your text message (140 characters maximum)' - see 'view past notes' from 'your text message (140 characters maximum)' - see blue 'send text message' button 5. Select 'view past notes' from 'your text message (140 characters maximum)' - past text messages appear - see 'filter by message' option on top of all past notes list - see 'show full message contents' checkbox - 'load more' option on the right below all past notes - pressing 'X' in the top right corner of all past text messages, will close all past messages and return to 'your text message (140 characters maximum)' field 6. Press 'X' in the top right corner pd 'send a note' popup screen - 'send a note' screen closed - return to attendance dashboard page

case.title: Add Contact - 'type/ choose a family member type... ' option

custom.steps: 1. Under 'type/ choose a family member type...' see options: - primary - will receive all information from tadpole, that includes daily reports, photos and videos, notes sent by email or text, and emergency alert - guardian - will only receive daily reports, photos and videos - medical - will only receive any communication from tadpoles, this contact is just for the reference to have - friend - will receive occasional photo and video sent directly by email - authorized - will not receive any information or communication from tadpoles, this contact is just for the reference to have - emergency - will not receive any information or communication from tadpoles, this contact is just for the reference to have - other - will not receive any information or communication from tadpoles, this contact is just for the reference to have - individual - will not receive any information or communication from tadpoles, this contact is just for the reference to have - contact - will not receive any information or communication from tadpoles, this contact is just for the reference to have

Add contacts on the right by selecting '+' - add contacts screen opens 8. custom.notes: Step 7: Assigning a classroom to a specific curriculum is going to determine the subject areas and goals the teachers will have access to when lesson planned or when tagging photos and videos
custom.steps: 1. Log in to www.tadpoles.com - land on home attendance page 2. Navigate to 'lesson plans' 3. Select 'mange Subjects and Goals' green button - curricula screen opens 4. Select curriculum from the curricula list on the left 5. Select 'add subject' - add subject or activity screen opens - Enter subject/ activity name - Enter sort order (determines in which order the subject/ activity listed) - select 'Save and Close' 6. Select 'add goal' -add development goal screen opens - type in specific name in the name field - enter 'learning standard identifier' (optional) - enter 'learning standard hierarchy' (optional) - Select 'Save and Close' 7. Select 'Apply to Classrooms' green button at the bottom - on 'apply curriculum' screen choose classrooms to which this curriculum will apply - select 'apply' - note at the bottom of curricula list appear: classrooms using [curriculum name] curriculum [classname] (indicates what classroom is using this curriculum) 8. Select 'x' in the top tight corner to exit entering curriculum - return to 'lessons plans' page of the dashboard

1. Log in to www.tadpoles.com - land on home attendance page 2. Navigate to 'lesson plans' 3. Select 'Manage Subjects and Goals' green button - curricula screen opens 4. Hover over curriculum and select edit - edit curriculum screen opens 5. Edit/ change name of the curriculum 6. Select 'Save and Close' - verify updated curriculum name in the curricula list

custom.notes: Days without lesson plan appear as grey boxes.
custom.steps: 1. Log in to www.tadpoles.com - land on home attendance page 2. Navigate to 'lesson plans' 3. Select any grey box day under the calendar to enter lesson plan - blank lesson plan for that day opens on the right side 4. Enter 'Notes' (if any), enter 'meals', enter 'activities', enter 'note to a teacher' - grey box turn blue indicating lesson plan was added

custom.preconds: Create lesson plan
custom.steps: 1. Log in to www.tadpoles.com - land on home attendance page 2. Navigate to 'lesson plans' 3. Select any blue box day under the calendar to edit lesson plan - lesson plan for that day opens on the right side 4. Select previously entered note under 'Notes' - edit/ change - select 'Save and Close' 5. Select previously entered meal under 'meals' - edit/ change - select 'Save and Close' 6. Select previously entered activity under 'activities' - edit/ change - select 'Save and Close' 7. Tap in the 'note to a teacher' area - edit/ change - verify all edits/ changes updated in the lesson plan

case.title: Staff with pin clock into building

custom.steps: 1. Login to tadpoles® Pro mobile app - land on tadpoles home screen 2. From home screen dashboard select 'staff in' - classroom roster screen opens 3. Select staff member from the right 'out' column - choose an action screen opens 4. Select 'Clock Into Building' - 'enter your pin...' screen opens 5. Enter pin - staff tile appear on the screen with blue clock in button 6. Select blue clock in button - select destination screen opens 7. Select your destination classroom - staff member clocked in - staff member tile moves to the left 'in' column

custom.preconds: Have a staff member clocked in
custom.steps: 1. From home screen dashboard select 'staff in' - classroom roster screen opens 2. Select staff member from the left 'in' column - choose an action screen opens 4. Select 'Clock Out of Building' - staff member clocked out - staff member tile moves to the right 'out' column

case.title: Staff with pin clock out of building

custom.preconds: Have a staff member clocked in
custom.steps: 1. From home screen dashboard select 'staff in' - classroom roster screen opens 2. Select staff member from the left 'in' column - choose an action screen opens 4. Select 'Clock Out of Building' - 'enter your pin...' screen opens 5. Enter pin - staff tile appear on the screen with blue yellow 'leave room' button and blue 'clock out' button 6. Select blue 'clock out' button - staff member clocked out - staff member tile moves to the right 'out' column

1. Login to tadpoles® Pro mobile app - land on tadpoles home screen 2. Select 'change class' - choose a classroom screen opens 3. Select your classroom 4. From home screen dashboard select 'staff in' - classroom roster screen opens 3. Select staff member from the right 'out' column - choose an action screen opens 4. Select 'Clock Into Building' - staff member clocked in the homeroom - staff member tile moves to the left 'in' column

case.title: Staff with pin clock into homeroom

custom.steps: 1. Login to tadpoles® Pro mobile app - land on tadpoles home screen 2. Select 'change class' - choose a classroom screen opens 3. Select your classroom 4. From home screen dashboard select 'staff in' - classroom roster screen opens 5. Select staff member from the right 'out' column - choose an action screen opens 6. Select 'Clock Into Building' - 'enter your pin' screen opens 7. Enter pin - staff tile appear on the screen with yellow 'enter room [class name]' button 8. Select yellow 'enter room [class name]' button - staff member clocked in the homeroom - staff member tile moves to the left 'in' column

custom.preconds: Have staff member clocked into homeroom
custom.steps: 1. From home screen dashboard select 'staff in' - classroom roster screen opens 2. Select staff member from the left 'in' column - choose an action screen opens 4. Select 'Sign Out of Room' - staff member remains in the building - staff member tile moves to the right 'out' column - staff tile display 'not in room' at the bottom of the tile

case.title: Staff with pin sign out of homeroom

custom.steps: 1. From home screen dashboard select 'staff in' - classroom roster screen opens 2. Select staff member from the left 'in' column - choose an action screen opens 4. Select 'Sign Out of Room' 5. Select pin 6. 1. Login to MyTS app - land on MyTS home screen 2. Swipe twice to the left 3. Select child's tile 4. Enter 'start time' - by pressing on 'now' button, it will display current time - buttons '-' & '+' next to 'now' button will add 5 min to selected start time or reduce by 5 min 6. Enter 'end time' - by pressing on 'now' button, it will display current time - buttons '-' & '+' next to 'now' button will add 5 min to selected start time or reduce by 5 min 7. Enter next sleep check 8. Enter notes - by pressing on 'past' button will open previously used notes in the small popup screen - by selecting previously used note, note will appear in the notes field 9. Select 'save' button - nap entry created and appears on the screen

Enter foods - select either 'all' or 'most' or 'some' or none' 8. Enter notes - by pressing on 'past' button will open previously used notes in the small popup screen - by selecting previously used note, note will appear in the notes field 9. Select 'save' button - meal entry created and appears on the screen

case.title: Child Profile - mark checked in child sick today

custom.preconds: Have child checked in
custom.steps: 1. Login to MyTS app - land on MyTS home screen 2. Navigate to roster screen by sliding 3 times to the left or selecting children in/ children out from dashboard home screen 3. Tap on a child tile from the checked in column - choose an option screen opens 4. Select 'Child Profile' - child's profile opens 5. Select red 'actions' button in the top right corner - 'Sick Today' and 'On vacation' option appear 6. Select 'Sick Today' - 'sickness detail' screen pops up 7. Type in sickness details 8. Select 'save' - child's tile moves from checked in column to checked out column - child's icon becomes greyed out - '(sick)' will appear at the bottom of the tile 9. Select child's icon 10. Select Child Profile - check attendance field - should show 'sick at [time child was marked sick] - [how many min ago child was marked sick from the current time] ago'

case.title: Move children from their homeroom to another classroom

custom.steps: 1. Log in to MyTS app as GOLD+Tadpoles User - land on MyTS home screen 2. Check in some children to their homeroom class 3. Navigate to children homeroom roster screen: either slide to the left three timer or select 'children in' - checked in children are on the left side on the roster screen - homeroom class name display in the title - number of children in and out display in the title 4. Press 'actions' 5. Select 'Move Class' 6. Select destination classroom (any) 7. Tap children to move to selected classroom - children icons gray out and list the room they’re being moved to at the bottom 8. Select 'done' - roster screen updates - classroom name where children were moved updates in the title of a roster - number of children in and out updates in the title of a roster 9. Navigate back to dashboard 10. Change class to your homeroom class 11. Select 'children in' - homeroom roster screen opens - homeroom class name display in the title - number of children in, out and visiting another class display in the title - children icons visiting another class are grayed out and list classroom they are visiting at the bottom

case.title: Move children from a room that is not their homeroom

custom.notes: Teachers should continue to see children icons on their screen (greyed out, with their destination at the bottom) until they press done.
custom.preconds: 1. Log in to MyTS app 2. Have some children checked in their homeroom class 2. Move children to another classroom they are visiting (not their homeroom)
custom.steps: 1. From MyTS dashboard navigate to roster screen of a room where children are visiting (not their homeroom): - either slide to the left three timer or select 'children in' - title of a roster screen display class name children are visiting - title display number of children in, out 3. Press 'actions' 4. Select 'Move Class' 5. Select destination classroom (any) 6. Tap children to move to the selected classroom - children icons gray out and list the room they’re being moved to at the bottom 7. Select 'done' - roster screen updates - classroom name where children were moved updates in the title of a roster - number of children in, out in a title of a roster updates to reflect current class attendance

case.title: Move children back to their homeroom

custom.preconds: 1. Login to MyTS app 2. Check in some children 3. Move some children to another classroom
custom.steps: 1. From MyTS dashboard change class to the homeroom class 2. Navigate to homeroom class roster screen by selecting 'children in' or swiping 3 times to the left - roster screen opens - number of children in, out, visiting another class display in the title - children icons visiting another class are grayed out 3. Tap on one of the the children - 'choose an action' screen opens 4. Select 'Move back' option - child's icon is not grayed out - child's icon doesn't list any classroom at the bottom - number of children in, out and visiting another class updates

case.title: Move only some children from their homeroom to another classroom

custom.steps: 1. Log in to MyTS app as GOLD+Tadpoles User - land on MyTS home screen 2. Check in some children to their homeroom class 3. Navigate to children homeroom roster screen: either slide to the left three timer or select 'children in' - checked in children are on the left side on the roster screen - homeroom class name display in the title - number of children in and out display in the title 4. Press 'actions' 5. Select 'Move Class' 6. Select destination classroom (any) 7. Tap on some children (not all) to move to selected classroom - selected children icons gray out and list the room they’re being moved to at the bottom 8. Select 'done' - roster screen updates - classroom name where some children were moved appear in the title of a roster - number of children in and out updates in the title of a roster 9. Navigate back to dashboard 10. Change class to your homeroom class 11. Select 'children in' - homeroom roster screen opens - homeroom class name display in the title - number of children in, out and visiting another class display in the title - children icons staying in the homeroom appear normal, not grayed out and don't list any classroom at the bottom - children icons visiting another class are grayed out and list classroom they are visiting at the bottom

case.title: Move different children from their homeroom to different classrooms

custom.steps: 1. Log in to MyTS app as GOLD+Tadpoles User - land on MyTS home screen 2. Check in some children to their homeroom class 3. Navigate to children homeroom roster screen: either slide to the left three times or select 'children in' - checked in children are on the left side on the roster screen - homeroom class name display in the title - number of children in and out display in the title 4. Press 'actions' 5. Select 'Move Class' 6. Select destination classroom [Class1] 7. Tap on some children (not all) [Child1], [Child2] to move to selected classroom [Class1] - [Child1[, [Child2] icons gray out and list the room [Class1] they’re being moved to at the bottom 8. Select 'done' - roster screen updates - classroom name where some children were moved appear in the title of a roster - number of children in and out updates in the title of a roster 9. Press 'actions' again 10. Select 'Move class' 11. Select different classroom destination [Class2] 12. Tap on some children (not all) [Child3], [Child4] to move to selected classroom [Class2] - [Child3], [Child4] icons gray out and list the classroom [Class2] they’re being moved to at the bottom 13. Select 'done' 14. Navigate back to dashboard 15. Change class to your homeroom class 16. Select 'children in' - homeroom roster screen opens - homeroom class name display in the title - number of children in, out and visiting another class display in the title - children icons staying in the homeroom appear normal, not grayed out and don't list any classroom at the bottom - children icons visiting another class are grayed out and list classroom they are visiting at the bottom

case.title: Login to MyTS app Practice Environment

custom.preconds: Register for Practice Environment on MyTS web first
custom.steps: 1. Log in to MyTeachingStrategies app - land on MyTS home screen 2. Select 'menu' option - menu popup screen opens 3. Select 'Access practice environment' - Message appear:'Access Practice Environment? Providing access to your Teaching Strategies Practice environment requires briefly logging you out of the MyTeachingStrategies app. After the logout, you will be asked to log back in, this time with your unique practice environment credentials. Proceed? 4. Select 'Yes' - MyTeachingStrategies Practice Environment login page opens 5. Enter login and password that was created by registering to the practice environment on MyTS web 6. Select 'Login' - successfully logged into the Practice Environment

custom.preconds: Register for Practice Environment on MyTS web first
custom.steps: 1. Log in to MyTeachingStrategies app 2. Select 'menu' option 3. Select 'Access practice environment' - Message appear:'Access Practice Environment? Providing access to your Teaching Strategies Practice environment requires briefly logging you out of the MyTeachingStrategies app. After the logout, you will be asked to log back in, this time with your unique practice environment credentials. Proceed? 4. Select 'Yes' - MyTeachingStrategies Practice Environment login page opens 5. Enter login and password that was created by registering to the practice environment on MyTS web 6. Select 'Login' - successfully logged in to the practice environment 7. Select 'Exit practice' in the left corner at the bottom - 'Whoa Do you want to log out now?' message appear 8. Select 'Yes' - user returns to MyTeachingStrategies log in page

case.title: "How do I find my practice environment login?" in MyTS app

custom.preconds: Register for Practice Environment on MyTS web first
custom.steps: 1. Log in to MyTeachingStrategies app - land on MyTS home screen 2. Select 'menu' option - menu popup screen opens 3. Select 'Access practice environment' - Message appear:'Access Practice Environment? Providing access to your Teaching Strategies Practice environment requires briefly logging you out of the MyTeachingStrategies app. After the logout, you will be asked to log back in, this time with your unique practice environment credentials. Proceed? 4. Select 'Yes' - MyTeachingStrategies Practice Environment login page opens 5. Click on "How do I find my practice environment login?" - will direct user to this link: https://teachingstrategies.force.com/portal/s/article/How-do-I-access-the-Practice-Environment - link opens successfully in a web browser view

case.title: MyTS Practice - Add Photo Documentation for a child - GOLD+Tadpoles User

custom.steps: 1. Login to MyTS app Practice Environment - land on MyTS Practice Environment dashboard 2. Slide to the left to take a photo 3. Press 'take a photo' - add documentation screen opens 4. Select a child from 'select children' column - selected child will appear on the right side of the screen - 'choose planned activity or area' screen opens 5. Select any area 6. Click on 'Select dimensions' - dimensions open 7. Select any dimension by selecting title of the dimension, then click on rainbow square - ratings will open 8. Select one of the ratings - ratings screen closed, user returns to dimensions screen 9. Email documentation delivery selected by default 10. Select 'send now' - documentation with photo sent - user returns to 'saved updates'/ saved photos screen

1. Login to MyTS Practice - land on MyTS Practice home screen 2. Swipe twice to the left 3. Touch child's tile to add nap 4. Select 'nap' at the bottom of the screen - add nap screen open - child's name displays below 'add nap' title 5. Enter 'start time' - by pressing on 'now' button, it will display current time - buttons '-' & '+' next to 'now' button will add 5 min to selected start time or reduce by 5 min 6. Enter 'end time' - by pressing on 'now' button, it will display current time - buttons '-' & '+' next to 'now' button will add 5 min to selected start time or reduce by 5 min 7. Enter next sleep check 8. Enter notes - by pressing on 'past' button will open previously used notes in the small popup screen 9. Select 'save' button - nap entry created and appears on the screen

Select 'potty' at the bottom of the screen - enter potty/ diaper info - press 'save' 7. Select 'activity' at the bottom of the screen - enter activity info - press 'save 8. Select' meds' at the bottom of the screen - enter meds info - press 'save' 9. Select 'note' at the bottom of the screen - enter note - press 'save' - all entries appear on the screen

1. Login to MyTS Practice - land on MyTS Practice home screen 2. Swipe twice to the left to daily reports 3. Touch child's tile to see daily report entries created that day 4. Select any of the entries listed on the screen - edit [entry name] screen opens 5. Edit entry 6. Press 'save' - return to all child's entries - verify edited changes

1. Login to MyTS Practice - land on MyTS Practice home screen 2. Swipe twice to the left to daily report 3. Touch child's tile to see daily report entries created that day 4. Select any of the entries listed on the screen 5. Select 'delete' - message appears 'Delete [name of the entry] entry? This action cannot be undone. Delete anyway? 6. Select 'Yes' - return to all child's entries - verify deleted entry is not listed o the screen

1. Login to MyTS Practice - land on MyTS Practice home screen 2. Navigate to in & out screen by sliding 3 times to the left or selecting children in/ children out from dashboard home screen 3. Select 'actions' in the top right corner - choose an action screen opens 4. Select 'Attendance (in/out) - choose an action screen disappears - see 'in' children on the right side of the screen - see 'out' children on the right side of the screen 5. Tap on a few children icons from 'out' on the right side - children appear in the 'in' side on the left 6. Tap on a few children icons from the 'in' side on the left - children appear in the 'out' side on the right

1. Login to MyTS Practice - land on MyTS Practice home screen 2. Navigate to roster screen by sliding 3 times to the left or selecting children in/ children out from dashboard home screen 3. Select 'actions' in the top right corner - choose an action screen opens 4. Select 'Sort Children' - small 'Sort Children by...' screen opens 5. Select sort by First Name - in and out children are sorted by First Name 6. Select sort by Last name - in and out children are sorted by Last Name 7. Select sort by Homeroom - children are sorted by Homeroom

custom.notes: A user's experience in the app's practice environment should match what they will see when they log into their actual account
custom.steps: 1. Log in to MyTS Practice as GOLD User - land on Practice home screen 2. Verify UI - Practice Environment UI should match 'GOLD only' site - see MyTeachingStrategies title at the top - see Practice Environment title below MyTeachingStrategies title - see blue tiles: change class, capture, children - 'exit practice' in the left corner below - 'menu' in the right corner below - 'touch a tile or slide' above menu option 3. Select 'change class' - 'choose a classroom' screen opens - able to change classroom - select 'x' from choose a classroom screen will close the screen 4. Select 'capture' - take a photo' screen opens - able to take back and front facing photos - video, audio, wright note options available - slide to the right to exit 'take a photo' screen 5. Select 'children' tile - see children list - selecting a child, will open child's profile screen - child's icon display with child's name next to it, contacts, memories, stage, homeroom are all present on child's profile - by clicking on 'actions' option 'Sort Children' and 'Change Class' appear - select 'Sort Children' - able to sort children by First and Last Name - select 'change' class - sort children by classroom

case.title: Register for MyTS web Practice Environment

custom.steps: 1. Login into MyTS web 2. Select 'Register for Practice Environment' from MyTeachingStrategies profile - Practice environment Registration popup screen opes - see message: Click the button below to register for the Practice Environment by copying your 9-digit security code and proceeding to registration. To successfully register, please ensure that your MyTeachingStrategies® email address is unique to you - see 'security code [...] 3. Select 'copy security code and proceed' to copy a unique security code into the registration page - MyTeachingStrategies Practice Environment registration page opens 4. Type in 'First Name' and 'Last Name' 5. Email address associated with your account is copied into the email field 6. Create unique 'Username' and 'Password' 7. The security code is copied into the security code field 8. Select 'next' 9. Select one or more classes to add to add to your Practice Environment 10. Select 'Register' - 'About' page will open 11. Select 'Close' - successfully registered to the Practice Environment

case.title: Forgot Password to MyTS web Practice Environment

custom.steps: 1. Login into MyTS web 2. Select 'Log In To Practice Environment' from MyTeachingStrategies profile menu - MyTeachingStrategies Practice Environment login page opens 3. Select 'Forgot password ? / ¿Olvidó su contraseña? - password reset screen opens with message 'To reset your password, you must register using your current username again. Select the button below to return to MyTeachingStrategies®. Your existing Practice Environment will be deleted and replaced with a new one. 4. Select Return to MyTeachingStrategies® - user returns to MyTeachingStrategies login page 5. Login into MyTS web again 6. Select 'Register for Practice Environment' from MyTeachingStrategies profile to create new Practice Environment - new Practice Environment created - old Practice Environment deleted

1. Login into MyTS web 2. Select 'Log In To Practice Environment' from MyTeachingStrategies profile menu - MyTeachingStrategies Practice Environment login page opens 3. Enter Practice Environment 'Username & Password' 4. Select 'Login' - successfully logged in to Practice Environment

custom.preconds: Log In To Practice Environment from MyTeachingStrategies profile menu
custom.steps: 1. Navigate to MyTeachingStrategies profile menu 2. Select 'Exit Practice Environment' - user navigates back to MyTeachingStrategies log in page

custom.preconds: 1. Have teaching strategies account set up that is synced to tadpoles 2. Make yourself a primary guardian of one of your test children
custom.steps: 1. Log in to https://my.teachingstrategies.com 2. Select 'Add Documentation' 3. enter 'date observed' 4. Select child 5. Select 'Upload a file' and choose multiple pic's 6. Press 'Save & Continue' - 'Way to Go! You've added some documentation.' popup message opens with option to 'Add another' and 'View Documentation' 7. Select 'View Documentation' 8. Select 'Share with Family' option on the left - 'share Documentation with Family' screen opens 9. Select' Submit' - see 'You have successfully shared' message - primary guardian receives email and app notification about shared document - primary guardian able to observe document and view multiple pic's

1. Login to MyTS Mobile as GOLD user 2. Navigate to children screen by tapping on 'children' tile from home screen or swiping twice to the left 3. Select [child1] tile - [child1] profile screen opens 4. Close [child1] profile by clicking on 'x' - [child1] ptofile closes 5. Select [child2] tile - [child2] tile opens 6. Close [child2] profile by clicking on 'x' - [child2] profile closes
